name: Idiopathic Segmental Arterial Mediolysis
chief_complaint: Severe, intermittent abdominal pain with episodes of dizziness
prognosis: Guarded due to risk of arterial rupture; 60% 5-year survival with aggressive treatment
description: A rare non-inflammatory arteriopathy characterized by vacuolization and lysis of vascular smooth muscle in medium-sized arteries, leading to dissection, aneurysm formation, or occlusion. Most commonly affects abdominal arteries but can occur in any vascular bed.
